intro: Trisetella fissidens, commonly known as the fissured sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer. Trisetella fissidens plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is often found in coastal or inland deserts.
